tweet: There are less than 4 million Bitcoins left to mine. What do you think the value of the last Bitcoin will be? Thousands of miners spending, in some cases, millions of dollars each to find it. Can the value be less than the effort? The value would have to be hundreds of millions.

The Bitcoin network is processing around 200k transactions per day. Given that only 20% have an economic purpose, & that Bitcoin users have to pay $10M per day (1,500 Btc/day in rewards) to the miners to keep the network running, each real transaction costs on average $250. Cool.
